channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Warren Buffett admits his Giving Pledge philanthropy was not ‘feasible’—he’s instead left his three kids $500 million a year to give away
item.description: The Berkshire Hathaway billionaire says his longevity has led to “unavoidable consequences” for his charitable objectives.

item.title: The Economic Repricing Of Water Has Already Started
item.description: Water risk is reshaping global markets as companies and investors confront rising scarcity, new valuation tools and the growing financial impact of wa...

item.title: Trump warns Supreme Court tariff ruling could trigger $3T ‘unwind’
item.description: Trump warns Supreme Court of $3 trillion economic 'unwind' if tariff case goes against him, calling potential outcome a national security threat.

item.title: Asian travel platform Klook is filing for a New York IPO
item.description: Klook revealed that it generated $417.1 million in revenue in 2024, a 24% increase. Yet the company isn’t profitable, losing $99.3 million last year.

item.title: Air Force veteran says cybersecurity is a natural career transition for civilian life—and it’s a field with more than 500,000 open jobs
item.description: A veteran has been trained to think like an adversary, says Air Force veteran Frankie Sclafani.

item.title: Who Owns The Future Of Compute? The Quest To Make AI Open For All
item.description: As demand for GPUs explodes, startups and nations are fighting for access to the compute power that drives AI progress.

item.title: These current Fortune 500 CEOs have served in the armed forces, including a foreign military
item.description: As Americans observe Veterans Day, here's a look at current Fortune 500 CEOs who have served in the military.

item.title: Final Tonalite Are The World’s First Personalized-Timbre Earbuds With 3D Head Scanning
item.description: These new earbuds from Final us a smartphone app that redefines audio using a revolutionary Digital Twin Audio Simulation that include personalized ti...

item.title: New York City business leaders are split on whether to relocate their firms to avoid Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani’s policies
item.description: None have announced definitive plans to do so, but some business leaders say they’re considering moving out.

item.title: Yes, Google Warns All Gmail Users To Stop Using Passwords—Act Now
item.description: "So long passwords," Google tells all 3 billion users — here's why.

item.title: Porn Ban—Google Issues VPN Warning For All Smartphone Users
item.description: Porn bans are already here and VPN usage has skyrocketed — but a new ban could be on its way, and it's much worse.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
